newsitem.title: ITALY: TENNIS-BERASATEGUI SUFFERS FOOD POISONING AFTER EASY WIN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-BERASATEGUI SUFFERS FOOD POISONING AFTER EASY WIN.

text.p: Spain's Alberto Berasategui suffered a severe bout of food poisoning moments after his opponent pulled out of their second round match at the Sicily international tennis tournament on Tuesday.
Berasategui, ranked 18th in the world, was leading 5-3 when Kris Goosens of Belgium was forced to abandon their match in the first set after suffering a pulled muscle.
The second-seeded Spaniard needed medical treatment in the dressing room after the game. It was not immediately clear whether he would be able to carry on in the tournament.
